programme.title: Zane Lowe
programme.synopsis: New and cutting edge music. Join the debate in the chat room, hear the hottest record in the world today and help choose another Fresh Meat winner. Plus live music from Editors.

programme.title: Jo Whiley's In Live Music We Trust
programme.synopsis: 100 per cent live music, with the best new Live Lounge, session and concert performances, plus a special documentary looking at The Twang.

programme.title: Mark Radcliffe and Stuart Maconie
programme.synopsis: Mark and Stuart present the best music, including a live session from Editors.

programme.title: The Charles Hazlewood Show
programme.synopsis: 6/8. Charles Hazlewood continues his series featuring eclectic musical exploration. He's joined in the studio by the counter-tenor Iestyn Davies.

programme.title: Performance on 3
programme.synopsis: The BBC Singers perform at the Finnish Tampere Festival in a programme of works by Vaughan-Williams, Britten, Tippet, Maxwell Davies, Giles Swayne, Edward Cowie and Judith Bingham.

programme.title: Composer of the Week
programme.synopsis: Bela Bartok (1881-1945): 3/5. Donald Macleod looks at Bartok's middle years as he struggled to find his own voice. Including String Quartet No 3 and Piano Concerto No 2.

programme.title: The Moral Maze
programme.synopsis: Michael Buerk chairs a debate on the moral questions behind the week's news. Clifford Longley, Michael Portillo, Ian Hargreaves and Steven Rose cross-examine witnesses.

programme.title: Lying Abroad
programme.synopsis: How to Be an Ambassador: Christopher Meyer, former British Ambassador in Washington, offers an insider's guide to the skills required in representing one's country overseas (4/4).

programme.title: Five Live Sport
programme.synopsis: Eleanor Oldroyd hosts an evening of sport debate, with a look back at Ascot with Cornelius Lysaght, tennis news in the week before Wimbledon, and the NFL's Dan Marino joins us.

programme.title: Anita Anand
programme.synopsis: An offbeat take on news, sport and politics. Including the latest money news at 10.45pm and 11.45pm. Text 85058 [network rates] or go to bbc.co.uk/fivelive for more information.

programme.title: On Sports Extra This Month...
programme.synopsis: Sports Extra Cricket: Coming up on Friday at 5.15pm, uninterrupted commentary on one of the day's top matches, as the Twenty20 Cup gets underway.

programme.title: On Sports Extra This Month...
programme.synopsis: Sports Extra Cricket: Coming up tomorrow at 5.15pm, uninterrupted commentary on one of the day's top matches, as the Twenty20 Cup gets underway.

programme.title: Marc Riley's Brain Surgery
programme.synopsis: Featuring the Earlies, purveyors of experimental psychedelic pop.

programme.title: 6 Music Plays it Again
programme.synopsis: Mica Paris continues to celebrate the music of the Maestro from Minneapolis.

programme.title: Bolt
programme.synopsis: The Killing Game: An accident befalls Prince Litsi when he meets Danielle. Dick Francis' thriller stars Sian Phillips. Episode 4 of 5. [Rpt of today 9.00am].

programme.title: Doctor Syn
programme.synopsis: Dr Syn pursues his enemy to America and falls in with pirates, among whom he encounters an unexpected friend. Episode 3 of 10. [Rpt of today 9.30am].

programme.title: UKG: The Blueprint with Richie Vee
programme.synopsis: The best UKG and the definitive top 10. Martin Control-S, Scott Maurice and MC Majestic are the guests. Txt 88111 [max cost 12p]. Up at 10.00pm - The Next Chapter with DJ Flight.

programme.title: D&B: Next Chapter with DJ Flight
programme.synopsis: Future drum & bass flavours, plus the latest styles and sounds from the heaviest in breaking new talent. Txt 88111 [max cost 12p]. Next at midnight - African: DNA with DJ Edu.

programme.title: Gujarati Programme
programme.synopsis: National: Music and entertainment in Gujarati. Presented by Dev Parmar. East Midlands: Music and entertainment in Punjabi, with Gurpreet.

programme.title: The Hype Show
programme.synopsis: Cutting-edge Brit-Asian music, breaking new artists and tracks, with DJ Kayper.

programme.title: A Year with the Nuclear Police
programme.synopsis: 1/2. A look at a year in the life of the International Atomic Energy Agency, presented by Rob Broomby.

programme.title: Discovery
programme.synopsis: Indispensables: 3/4. Erika Wright investigates revolutionary inventions now taken for granted across the world. This episode looks at the battery.
